articles.title: Nuclear Fusion Energy Breakthrough: Ignition Confirmed in Record 1.3 Megajoule Shot - SciTechDaily
articles.description: After decades of inertial confinement fusion research, a yield of more than 1.3 megajoules (MJ) was achieved for the first time on August 8, 2021. This put scientists at Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory’s (LLNL’s) National Ignition Facility (NIF) at the…
articles.content:
ByLawrence Livermore National LaboratoryAugust 14, 2022

articles.title: Researchers in South America Discover a New Species of Tiny but Tough Dinosaurs - ScienceAlert
articles.description: Fossils of a small, prickly dinosaur recently discovered in South America may represent an entire lineage of armored dinosaurs previously unknown to science.
articles.content:

articles.title: Mars enters the evening sky tonight, here's how to find the Red Planet - Space.com
articles.description: The Red Planet will be visible along with Jupiter, Saturn and Uranus.
articles.content:
The Red Planet is finally rising before midnight.

articles.title: Why I'll never go back to countryside after move to Glasgow, Scotland - Insider
articles.description: Insider's Mikhaila Friel recently moved to Glasgow, the Scottish city that was named one of the coolest in the world by Time Out.

articles.description: NASA calls the Perseids, which return every summer, one of the best annual meteor showers.
